title: Graduate Researcher
employer: National Institute of Standards and Technology
comments: Creating new measurement and verification techniques with LTE and 5G devices for the detection of anomalies in communications systems.
Developed software and measurement techniques for wideband wireless virtual array measurements with the NIST SAMURAI system.
learned established measurement tools, techniques, and calibrations from experts with hands-on instruction.

title: PhD Candidate
comments: Researching the usage of Monte Carlo techniques to improve channel estimation for fifth-generation millimeter-wave wireless communication systems

Developed and verified software to simulate RF hardware in large-scale phased arrays and measured wireless propagation channels to evaluate channel estimators in 5G Millimeter-Wave communications systems.
Accelerated simulations of RF hardware and electromagnetic simulations using multiple GPUs and distributed computing systems.

title: Summer Intern
comments: Helped coordinate the development of tools for future human space launch systems
Worked with a team to analyze accidents and errors that occurred during the construction and launch of aerospace systems.
Advancing professional skills and experience working with teams of engineers from various backgrounds

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
comments: Simulated electromagnetic propagation with a high-order finite difference time domain (FDTD) algorithm.
Implemented electromagnetic simulations on GPUs and a supercomputer using CUDA and MPI.
Developed methods for integrating high-order algorithms and complex CAD models into existing simulation software.

title: Teaching Assistant
comments: Worked with new students on open ended engineering design projects to better the local community.
Mentored student's professional skills and design experience to help them get started in their college careers as engineering students.

title: Rocket Sat X EPS Team Member
position: Rocket Sat X EPS Team Member
comments: Developed an electronic system to inductively melt aluminum in under a minute.
Manufactured PCBs and circuit peripherals to track and store sensor measurements from the system.

title: Sales Associate
comments: Assisted customers in finding shoes that matched their applications.
